meta_description: Where history, art, and culture converge across six unique exhibits. Discover a world of wonder with us!
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

Explore five unique exhibits in one extraordinary museum experience!

## Have Questions?

We aim to make Blackhawk Museum an exciting, educational, and enjoyable experience for everyone. If you have any questions about your visit and the services we offer, please call [(925) 736-2280](tel:925-736-2280) or email us at [info@blackhawkmuseum.org](mailto:info@blackhawkmuseum.org).

[Purchase Tickets](https://blackhawkmuseum.ticketing.veevartapp.com/tickets/view/list)

## Regular Hours

Day| Time  
---|---  
Friday| 10am – 5pm  
Saturday| 10am – 5pm  
Sunday| 10am – 5pm  
Monday| Closed  
Tuesday| Closed  
Wednesday| Closed  
Thursday| Closed  
  
## Holiday Hours

Day| Time  
---|---  
Independence Day (7/04)| Closed  
Thanksgiving (11/26)| Closed  
Friday (11/27)| 10am – 5pm  
Saturday (11/28)| 10am – 5pm  
Sunday (11/29)| 10am – 5pm  
Christmas Eve (12/24)| Closed  
Christmas (12/25)| Closed  
New Year’s Eve (12/31)| Closed  
New Year’s Day (01/01)| Closed  
  
## Parking & Directions

Address: [3700 Blackhawk Plaza Circle, Danville, CA, 94506](https://maps.app.goo.gl/gtq6imD3snyjsd7aA)

The Blackhawk Museum has three free designated parking areas. Upon parking, please follow the directional arrows to the museum courtyard, where the main entrance to the museum can be found.

The main plaza parking lot also features 15 Tesla Charging stations, allowing electric vehicle owners to charge while exploring the museum.

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

Ensuring an inclusive and enjoyable experience for all visitors.

Blackhawk Museum is an ADA compliant facility — with two elevators granting visitors access to all galleries and wide pathways for ease of access. We are not yet able to accommodate those who rely on braille.

## Wheelchair Access

Wheelchairs may enter the museum via the ramps to the left of the stairs at the Main Entrance. All galleries are accessible for wheelchairs. Additionally, our staff is available to assist with any special needs or accommodations to ensure a pleasant visit for everyone.

## Accessible Parking

For the convenience of our visitors with disabilities, handicap parking is located in the closest parking lot to the museum. In the event that the handicap parking is fully occupied, we kindly request that you utilize the drop-off area in the nearest parking lot to the museum entrance.  

## Accessible Restrooms

Wheelchair accessible restrooms are available in the museum for the convenience of all visitors. These restrooms are equipped with features designed to accommodate individuals with mobility challenges, ensuring a comfortable and accessible experience for everyone.

## Service Animals

In order to provide a secure and healthy environment for our guests, as well as to protect our collections, we can only allow service animals in our museum. Please leave any other four-legged friends at home.

## [Daughters of Daring: Women of the West Who Wouldn’t Behave](https://blackhawkmuseum.org/events/daughters-of-daring-women-of-the-west-who-wouldnt-behave/)

Daughters of Daring: Women of the West Who Wouldn’t Behave is an immersive, story-driven presentation that spotlights fearless women who defied expectations and helped shape the American West onstage, onscreen, and far beyond the margins of “polite” society. Presented by New York Times bestselling author Chris Enss.
